item.title: Is Wine Really Healthy For You? The Controversy Continues!: A Guest Post by Richard Norton
item.description:
Is Wine Really Healthy For You? The Controversy Continues!: A Guest Post by Richard Norton

Hello readers! I am currently on my maternity leave spending some quality time (and little sleep) with my brand new son! Enjoy this guest post from today's featured author! The following is a guest post by Richard Norton.

item.title: Why That Per Se Review May Change Fine Dining Forever
item.description:
Why That Per Se Review May Change Fine Dining Forever

"The lady had dropped her napkin. More accurately, she had hurled it to the floor in a fit of disillusionment,"The New York Times review of Per Se began, and every fine dining establishment shuddered.

item.title: At Thomas Keller's Per Se, Slips and Stumbles
item.description:
At Thomas Keller's Per Se, Slips and Stumbles

The lady had dropped her napkin. More accurately, she had hurled it to the floor in a fit of disillusionment, her small protest against the slow creep of mediocrity and missed cues during a four-hour dinner at Per Se that would cost the four of us close to $3,000.

item.title: Thomas Keller - Message to Our Guests
item.description:
Thomas Keller - Message to Our Guests

Thomas Keller is chef and proprietor of The French Laundry, Per Se, Bouchon, Bar Bouchon, Bouchon Bakery, and Ad Hoc. He has authored five cookbooks inspired by his restaurants.

item.title: Video Theater
item.description:
Video Theater

Wines from Bordeaux have a reputation for being pricey, and some bottles do sell for thousands of dollars. How can you find red Bordeaux values? Senior editor James Molesworth shares his favorite tips in this video. Catch his latest reviews in Wine Spectator's March 31 issue. (37sec) Which sub-regions offer great value Bordeaux?

item.title: Decanting & Napa History: 1974 & 2011 Cab with Peter Mondavi Jr. of Charles Krug
item.description:
Decanting & Napa History: 1974 & 2011 Cab with Peter Mondavi Jr. of Charles Krug

Two wines made nearly 4 decades apart show the evolution of Napa Cabernet. Learn the difference in decanting fully mature and young Cabs as well as what to look for in these wines as Peter Mondavi Jr. of Charles Krug joins Gloria Maroti Frazee.
